subject: Law
title: Unconscionability
description: A fast breakdown of Unconscionability for builders.

hook.text: A payday lender charges 400% interest to a desperate borrower. A court can refuse to enforce that deal.

buildup.text: Unconscionability lets courts void contracts that are so unfair they shock the conscience.

discovery.text: Two types: procedural (unfair processâ€”no real choice) and substantive (unfair termsâ€”outrageously one-sided).

twist.text: Most courts require both types. Unfair terms alone aren't enough if the process was transparent.

climax.text: It's a safety valve. Courts use it sparingly to prevent extreme exploitation, not to rewrite bad deals.

punchline.text: Freedom to contract has limits. Exploitation is one of them.

quiz.question: What are the two types of unconscionability?
